subject: Travel
title: Street Food Capital: Bangkok
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Street Food Capital: Bangkok.

hook.text: Bangkok has over 300,000 street food vendors. You can eat three full meals a day for under five dollars.

buildup.text: Thai street food isn't fast food â€” cooks spend hours on broth, curry paste, and fresh ingredients.

discovery.text: A street food vendor named Jay Fai earned a Michelin star. She cooks wearing ski goggles over a hot wok.

twist.text: In 2017, Bangkok tried banning street vendors for sidewalk cleanliness. Public outrage reversed the plan.

climax.text: Thai street food culture is now on UNESCO's intangible heritage watchlist for preservation.

punchline.text: The world's best food sometimes comes from a sidewalk.

quiz.question: What is unique about street food vendor Jay Fai?
options: She's the oldest vendor in Bangkok
